content:
• Tuesday, August 16, 2011
  • BCSI

    More on the Blue Coat Systems (NASDAQ:BCSI) miss: President and CEO Mike Borman is stepping down...

    More on the Blue Coat Systems (NASDAQ:BCSI) miss: President and CEO Mike Borman is stepping down to be replaced by Greg Clark, formerly chief of Mincom.  Shares -15.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • WMB

    Williams (NYSE:WMB) reaffirms its $44/share offer for Southern Union (NYSE:SUG), touting its...

    Williams (NYSE:WMB) reaffirms its $44/share offer for Southern Union (NYSE:SUG), touting its all-cash solidity over the competing $44.25 offer from Energy Transfer Equity (ETE), one that "includes illiquid partnership units whose value will be exposed to equity markets in the months until closing and beyond." SUG +2.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • DELL-OLD

    More on Dell's (DELL-OLD) FQ2 results: Non-GAAP gross margin of 23.2%, down from 23.4% in FQ2...

    More on Dell's (DELL-OLD) FQ2 results: Non-GAAP gross margin of 23.2%, down from 23.4% in FQ2 2010. Growth led by SMB sales (+5%), and hurt by Public sales (-3%). Services (+6%) and server/networking (+9%) revenues were strong. However, storage revenue was -20% (declining EMC hardware sales), and PC revenue fell 1%. DELL-OLD -6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • ADI

    More on Analog Devices (NASDAQ:ADI): Despite lower revenue, operational execution remained...

    More on Analog Devices (NASDAQ:ADI): Despite lower revenue, operational execution remained strong leading to GM of 67,2%, OM of 36.8%, OCF of $257M. Sees 4QFY11 revenue at $715M-$755M (flat to -6% Q/Q), GM of 65%-66%, Operating expenses of flat to -3% Q/Q, EPS of $0.60-$0.68. Sees FY11 Revenue over $3.0B (+9% Y/Y), OM of 36%, OCF of ~$900M. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • BCSI

    Blue Coat Systems (NASDAQ:BCSI): Q1 EPS of $0.18 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $109.5M misses by...

    Blue Coat Systems (NASDAQ:BCSI): Q1 EPS of $0.18 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $109.5M misses by $4M. Company guides for Q2 revenues to $103-$110M, below $116M Street forecast.  Shares -10% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • ADI

    Analog Devices (NASDAQ:ADI): FQ3 EPS of $0.71 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $758M (+5% Y/Y) misses...

    Analog Devices (NASDAQ:ADI): FQ3 EPS of $0.71 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $758M (+5% Y/Y) misses by $22M. Shares -3.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell (DELL-OLD): FQ2 EPS of $0.54 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $15.66B (+1% Y/Y) misses by $102M....

    Dell (DELL-OLD): FQ2 EPS of $0.54 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $15.66B (+1% Y/Y) misses by $102M. $2.4B in operating cash flow, $1.1B in shares repurchased. Company now expects FY12 operating income growth of 17-23%, up from 12-18%. Expects 1-5% FY12 revenue growth, down from 5-9%. DELL-OLD -5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • GILD

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +4.2%) trades higher into the close after J.P. Morgan added the drug maker...

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +4.2%) trades higher into the close after J.P. Morgan added the drug maker to its "focus list" earlier today, citing growth in its research pipeline and the undervalued potential of the company's new HIV drugs. Separately, Deutsche calls the company "its top value stock," with a potential 40% return over the next year.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • GOOG

    S&P cuts Google (GOOG -3.4% to $538.32) to Sell; not only is the agency down on the Motorola...

    S&P cuts Google (GOOG -3.4% to $538.32) to Sell; not only is the agency down on the Motorola Mobility (NYSE:MMI) deal's impact on growth, but it's "not sure" it'll even spare Android the legal headaches that many analysts now see as the key reason for the acquisition. New price target: $500, down from $700.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 5 Comments
  • DANG

    Chinese online retailer Dangdang (DANG -13.5%) sinks after its Q2 net loss widenened, as...

    Chinese online retailer Dangdang (DANG -13.5%) sinks after its Q2 net loss widenened, as competitive pricing and higher costs for promotional measures weigh on gross margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • RGS

    Regis (RGS +7%) is trading at session highs after shareholder Starboard Value sent the company a...

    Regis (RGS +7%) is trading at session highs after shareholder Starboard Value sent the company a letter saying it's deeply undervalued, urging the hair-salon operator to reduce operating expenses and exit non-core businesses to improve stock-price performance.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • ARO

    Aeropostale (ARO +3.6%) shares move after the teen clothing retailer is upgraded to Hold by...

    Aeropostale (ARO +3.6%) shares move after the teen clothing retailer is upgraded to Hold by Jefferies. After significant top-line and margin erosion, Jefferies says the bad news is now priced into the stock, and the business can strengthen once the environment normalizes. Also, hedge fund manager David Einhorn bought the stock in Q2, according to a 13-F filing.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • S

    Sprint Nextel (S +3.7%) holds on to gains late in the day after Collins Stewart raised it to buy...

    Sprint Nextel (S +3.7%) holds on to gains late in the day after Collins Stewart raised it to buy earlier on valuation. The firm sees it as an attractive long-term idea, with fairly low expectations through the end of 2012 but potential for margin growth in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • A

    Agilent Technologies (A -2.7%) is in focus after Deutsche maintains its Buy rating on shares...

    Agilent Technologies (A -2.7%) is in focus after Deutsche maintains its Buy rating on shares with a lower price target, $48 from $61. In a similar vein, Stifel Nicolaus trims its PT to $50, from $59, and keeps a Buy rating in place. The scientific equipment maker sees Q4 EPS of $0.79-$0.81, in-line with analysts' consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • HD

    Home Depot (HD +5.5%) is up after beating Q2 estimates and lifting FY11 guidance this morning;...

    Home Depot (HD +5.5%) is up after beating Q2 estimates and lifting FY11 guidance this morning; archrival Lowe's (LOW +2%), by contrast, only edged higher yesterday after missing Q2 forecasts. Q2 represents the 9th straight quarter Home Depot's same-store sales outpaced Lowe's - the company's store overhaul strategy appears to be paying off. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • KAMN

    Kaman Aerospace (KAMN +2.7%) gains after being awarded a $47M joint contract with Lockheed...

    Kaman Aerospace (KAMN +2.7%) gains after being awarded a $47M joint contract with Lockheed Martin (LMT +0.6%) to develop autonomous technologies for unmanned air systems for the U.S. Army. The contract will focus on enhancing capabilities to support unmanned cargo resupply missions.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • VCI

    S&P announces Valassis Communications (VCI +3.1%) will replace Immucor (BLUD +0.2%) in its...

    S&P announces Valassis Communications (VCI +3.1%) will replace Immucor (BLUD +0.2%) in its S&P 400 MidCap 400 Index (IJH -1.2%) after Thursday's trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • KID

    Kid Brands (KID -17%) takes a hit this morning, after its Q2 swung to a bigger loss on charges...

    Kid Brands (KID -17%) takes a hit this morning, after its Q2 swung to a bigger loss on charges related to higher custom duty payments and the implementation of new crib safety standards. The company also lowers FY11 guidance, citing softness in consumer demand and reduced inventory.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • YOKU

    Chinese video site Youku.com (YOKU -11.3%), which fell last week following Q2 results, is...

    Chinese video site Youku.com (YOKU -11.3%), which fell last week following Q2 results, is nosediving today in advance of rival Tudou's IPO. Tudou, which is looking to raise as much as $180M and reportedly received a buyout offer from Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU), was forced to discount its offering price following the market's recent decline.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • STRI

    STR Holdings (STRI +2%) holds on to gains after agreeing to sell its quality assurance business...

    STR Holdings (STRI +2%) holds on to gains after agreeing to sell its quality assurance business for $275M to Underwriters Laboratories.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • EVLV

    ValueVision Media (VVTV -27%) craters after its Q2 estimates missed the mark, as the...

    ValueVision Media (VVTV -27%) craters after its Q2 estimates missed the mark, as the home-shopping retailers that operate under its ShopNBC brand continue to register tepid sales growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 3 Comments

  • European shares are closed for the day and unable to register their displeasure at no new magic...

    European shares are closed for the day and unable to register their displeasure at no new magic bullet being unveiled in Paris. Euro-ETFs trading in the states are moving lower. Germany EWG -3.3%, Italy EWI -3.6%, Spain EWP -2.8%, MSCI Europe VGK -2.1%, European financials EUFN -2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 2 Comments
  • KAR

    KAR Auction Services (KAR +3.7%) trades higher after it purchases auto remarketer Openlane...

    KAR Auction Services (KAR +3.7%) trades higher after it purchases auto remarketer Openlane (OTC:OPNN +0.7%) for $210M in an all-cash deal, as the auctioneer of used and damaged vehicles aims to boost its online product offerings.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM

  • The stock market sinks to its low of the session following the Merkel/Sarkozy press conference....

    The stock market sinks to its low of the session following the Merkel/Sarkozy press conference. Seemingly dependent upon a constant stream of government rescues, bailouts, and actions against sellers, shares are quick to turn tail when disappointed. S&P -1.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • AGN

    Allergan (AGN +1.3%) trades higher on a CS First Boston valuation upgrade. The firm says an...

    Allergan (AGN +1.3%) trades higher on a CS First Boston valuation upgrade. The firm says an improving R&D pipeline and strong postioning of its glaucoma products to compete with generic alternatives should spur margin growth in H2.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • BIDU

    Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU) falls 5.9% after China's state TV accuses the firm of both failing to...

    Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU) falls 5.9% after China's state TV accuses the firm of both failing to confirm advertiser credentials  - causing fake medicine ads to fool consumers - and running a rigged advertising bid process. Even before the negative report, S&P Equity cut its rating on shares to Buy from Strong Buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • MEIP

    Shares of micro-cap biotech Marshall Edwards (MSHL) soar +58% after the company announces its...

    Shares of micro-cap biotech Marshall Edwards (MSHL) soar +58% after the company announces its application for an investigational new anti-tumor drug has been approved by the FDA.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • KCI

    Kinetic Concepts (KCI +3%) jumps on reports that private-equity firms Bain Capital and Avista...

    Kinetic Concepts (KCI +3%) jumps on reports that private-equity firms Bain Capital and Avista Capital are considering a takeover bid that would top Apax Partners' $5B offer.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • RGS

    Hair care salon operator Regis (RGS +4.7%) is moving higher after 4.4% shareholder Starboard...

    Hair care salon operator Regis (RGS +4.7%) is moving higher after 4.4% shareholder Starboard Value issues a letter calling on the company to "explore strategic alternatives" for several "non-core assets." Starboard believes such moves could produce $100M in annual cost savings.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • RIG

    Transocean (RIG -2.9%) trades lower today after S&P put the stock on creditwatch with...

    Transocean (RIG -2.9%) trades lower today after S&P put the stock on creditwatch with negative implications, following its $2.2B bid to acquire Aker Drilling. The ratings agency says the all cash and debt deal will weaken the company's financial profile and likely lead to a downgrade.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • FN

    Fabrinet (FN +21%) is now soaring after easily beating FQ4 estimates. JPMorgan upgrades the...

    Fabrinet (FN +21%) is now soaring after easily beating FQ4 estimates. JPMorgan upgrades the stock to overweight on the report, saying it sees "signs of stabilizing optical component demand," and the company "may not be getting adequate consideration for potential secular strength that is not tied to the macro climate."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • FFNT

    FriendFinder Networks (FFN -13.8%) falls after reporting 2% lower revenue in Q2 compared to a...

    FriendFinder Networks (FFN -13.8%) falls after reporting 2% lower revenue in Q2 compared to a year ago with a wider EPS loss. The firm averaged 911,560 subscribers for the reporting period, a falloff of 11% compared to last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • PTX

    Specialty pharmaceutical developer Pernix Therapeutics (PTX +18%) takes off after Q2 earnings...

    Specialty pharmaceutical developer Pernix Therapeutics (PTX +18%) takes off after Q2 earnings easily beat expectations. Revenues leapt 178% Y/Y to $12M, easily topping analyst estimates for $7.1M, on record sales of its CEDAX formulation and improvement from its generic product line.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • JKS

    JinkoSolar (NYSE:JKS) gains 4.4% after reporting Q2 revenue of $350.6M (+6% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    JinkoSolar (NYSE:JKS) gains 4.4% after reporting Q2 revenue of $350.6M (+6% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.46, beating consensus by $35.2M and $0.12. Gross margin was 25.4% down 1.4% Y/Y. The company attributes its relatively strong performance to its vertical integration. It expects 2011 revenue of $1.4B-$1.5B, above a $1.34B consensus. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • PII

    Polaris Industries (PII +2.8%) receives a boost from BMO Capital with an upgrade to Outperform...

    Polaris Industries (PII +2.8%) receives a boost from BMO Capital with an upgrade to Outperform from Market Perform, along with a new price target of $130. The firm sees the vehicle maker's new product line helping drive momentum.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • GLD

    More on the Swiss franc move: With even the Swiss now overtly in the business of currency...

    More on the Swiss franc move: With even the Swiss now overtly in the business of currency devaluation, money flows into gold, the yellow metal spiking $20 higher as the franc dives. GLD +1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM | 2 Comments
  • ALB

    Specialty chemical maker Albemarle (ALB -5.4%) is down this morning after Oppenheimer cut the...

    Specialty chemical maker Albemarle (ALB -5.4%) is down this morning after Oppenheimer cut the the stock to outperform, citing margin pressure from consumer electronics de-stocking and the impact from slack crude prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • FXF

    The dollar spikes 2% higher vs. the Swiss franc as the SNB's Thomas Jordan says the bank is...

    The dollar spikes 2% higher vs. the Swiss franc as the SNB's Thomas Jordan says the bank is assessing "a whole range of options" to cool its currency's strength. "The franc is drastically overvalued," says Christoph Blocher, a formerly hard-money politician. FXF -0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • VIT

    Shares of VanceInfo (VIT -28.6%) implode after the firm records a Q2 EPS miss of $0.02, and...

    Shares of VanceInfo (VIT -28.6%) implode after the firm records a Q2 EPS miss of $0.02, and issues downward revenue and EPS guidance for Q3. The China-based software firm blames its margin pressure on the "rising inflationary environment in China," and says the near-term outlook isn't clear for the industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM | 1 Comment
  • RLRN

    Educational assessment software developer Renaissance Learning (RLRN +24.3%) is being acquired...

    Educational assessment software developer Renaissance Learning (RLRN +24.3%) is being acquired by PE firm Permira Funds for $14.85/share in cash, or roughly $440M. The transaction is expected to close in Q4. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • DKS

    More on Dick's Stores (NYSE:DKS): The company lowers its Q3 EPS guidance to $0.24-0.26 from an...

    More on Dick's Stores (NYSE:DKS): The company lowers its Q3 EPS guidance to $0.24-0.26 from an anticipated $0.28. Shares -7.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • TJX

    TJX Companies (NYSE:TJX): Q2 EPS of $0.90 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $5.47B (+8% Y/Y) beats by...

    TJX Companies (NYSE:TJX): Q2 EPS of $0.90 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $5.47B (+8% Y/Y) beats by $30M. Sees FY12 EPS of $3.89-3.97. Shares -1.17% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM
  • SBUX

    Shares of Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) fall 2.2% premarket after J.M. Smucker (NYSE:SJM) announces a...

    Shares of Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) fall 2.2% premarket after J.M. Smucker (NYSE:SJM) announces a 6% price cut on most of its coffee brands in what could be the opening salvo of a price war. Coffee futures have fallen lower since May after an extended run-up.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM
  • MT

    Shares of ArcelorMittal (NYSE:MT) fall 4% premarket as the firm says it could lose about 400K...

    Shares of ArcelorMittal (NYSE:MT) fall 4% premarket as the firm says it could lose about 400K tons of steel due to a structural failure at a Newcastle plant.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM
  • FN

    Shares of Fabrinet (NYSE:FN) are up 6.6% premarket after the firm records a $0.04 EPS beat. The...

    Shares of Fabrinet (NYSE:FN) are up 6.6% premarket after the firm records a $0.04 EPS beat. The tech concern saw revenue of $190M (+48% Y/Y) for FQ4, and issues guidance for FY12 Q1 at $173M-$178M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 AM
  • SKS

    Saks (NYSE:SKS): Q2 EPS of -$0.05 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $670.18M (+13% Y/Y) beats by $6.3M....

    Saks (NYSE:SKS): Q2 EPS of -$0.05 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $670.18M (+13% Y/Y) beats by $6.3M. Shares +1.4% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM
